relations.title: Sustainability of Digital Formats: Planning for Library of Congress Collections

name: DV, DVCAM, DVCPRO (family of related formats)
description: Video format developed in the early 1990s as a media-dependent videocassette format.  DV video signals are compressed using discrete cosine transforms (DCT) within each frame.  DV does not use frame-to-frame temporal encoding. Later, similar but higher quality elaborations were offered by SONY (DVCAM) and Panasonic (DVCPRO, DVCPRO-50, DVCPRO HD), used in professional television production.
